content.description: A consumer group is investigating two brands of popcorn, R and S. The population proportion of kernels that will pop for Brand R is 0.90. The population proportion of kernels that will pop for Brand S is 0.85. Two independent random samples were taken from the population. The following table shows the sample statistics.
content.question: Number of Kernels in Samples Proportion from Sample that Popped Brand R 100 0.92 Brand S 200 0.89 The consumer group claims that for all samples of size 100 kernels from Brand R and 200 kernels from Brand S, the mean of all possible differences in sample proportions (Brand R minus Brand S) is 0.03. Is the consumer group’s claim correct?

choices.label: Yes. The mean is <math alttext="0.92 minus 0.89 equals 0.03" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.92</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.89</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.03</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

No. The mean is <math alttext="the fraction 0.92 plus 0.89 over 2 equals 0.905" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.92</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.89</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.905</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

No. The mean is <math alttext="the fraction 0.92 minus 0.89 over 2 equals 0.015 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.92</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.89</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.015</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

No. The mean is <math alttext="the fraction 0.90 plus 0.85 over 2 equals 0.875" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.90</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.85</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.875</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
No. The mean is <math alttext="0.90 minus 0.85 equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.90</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.85</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: No. The mean is <math alttext="0.90 minus 0.85 equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.90</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.85</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 5.6: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Proportions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
